meta.description: Author John Nores returns to the podcast to the status of the hidden war on public lands and how border policies affect wildlands.

title: Drug cartels continue to wage war on public lands (ft. John Nores)
cleaned_text:
“If we don’t take this seriously and treat it as a national priority, we’re not gonna have water and wildlife is gonna die. Rather they’re poached, you know, by an illegal gun from a cartel gunmen that’s gonna eat the animal perhaps, or stop one from hindering his plants versus just depleting the resource of taking all habitat away because marijuana takes space, like any crop.” — John Nores, author of HIDDEN WAR

In Episode 343 of District of Conservation, Gabriella speaks with past guest John Nores at this past weekend’s Safari Club International convention in Nashville, TN. Nores released a 2nd edition of his popular book, Hidden War, and discussed how drug cartels continue to wage war on public lands.
